text: Preparing the Lentils Rinse the red lentils.  Soak them in warm water for an hour.  Drain.  Making the Ragout Cut the bacon into half inch slices.  Fry until crispy in the pot you'll be using for the ragout.  Set bacon bits aside on paper towels.  Add the sliced fennel, carrots, and onion to the pot, along with the salt. Sauté in bacon grease for 6 to 8 minutes. Add the stock, thyme, pepper and lentils. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes. The lentils should absorb most of the broth. Remove from heat. If the lentils cook for too long, they get mushy. Right Before Serving Mix in the lemon juice, lemon zest, and bacon bits.  Serve.
